Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by grant 1R01HL158071 to Mina K. Chung, MD, John Barnard, PhD, Anant Madabhushi, PhD, and M. Benjamin Shoemaker, MD, from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for "NOVEL CT RADIOMIC APPROACHES TO IMPROVE TARGETING FOR ATRIAL FIBRILLATION CATHETER ABLATION" can be found here: (Journal Citation __________)(PMID __________). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution.
